entry.name: nth-last-child
entry.title: :nth-last-child() Selector

argument.name: index
argument.desc: The index of each child to match, starting with the last one (1), the string even or odd, or an equation ( eg. :nth-last-child(even), :nth-last-child(4n) )

entry.desc: Selects all elements that are the nth-child of their parent, counting from the last element to the first.

longdesc.p: Because jQuery's implementation of :nth- selectors is strictly derived from the CSS specification, the value of n is "1-indexed", meaning that the counting starts at 1. For other selector expressions such as :eq() or :even jQuery follows JavaScript's "0-indexed" counting. Given a single <ul> containing three <li>s, $( "li:nth-last-child(1)" ) selects the third, last, <li>.
Further discussion of this usage can be found in the W3C CSS specification.

example.desc: Find the second to last li in each matched ul and note it.
This is a playground to see how the selector works with different strings.
